Posts.Content: Kimmi98660 wrote: I'm 29 years old.  I had a baby 16 months ago.  Only breast fed her first month.  About two months ago I noticed my left breast was slightly larger then my other which it has never been so I decide to give myself a self breast exam.  I noticed a bump about two inches from my chest wall when laying down.  It felt like a little bouncy ball you get out of quarter machines at the store.  I had a routine pap coming up so I waited to tell my doctor.  He felt it and scheduled me for a breast ultrasound at the breast center.  The tech couldn't see anything so she brought the doctor in.  She felt it and said yep there is defiantly something there and said she could even feel it when she moved the ultrasound wand over it. But she couldn't see anything on the screen.  She said since I was 29 getting a mammogram wouldn't give much benefit and says just watch it over the next couple of months for changes.  My grandmother (moms side) died from breast cancer in 1994 and my aunt had cervical cancer in her early 20's mom side too.  I'm worried.  What should I do? Leave it be as it is? She said it could just be a bump I have for 20 years.  Or should I ask for a different test? I don't know much about this and I have no idea what to do or what to ask.  Please anyone if they have advice it would be much appreciated! Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please I need some advice about what to do. Kimmi98660 rcm

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2011 06:09PM Kimmi98660 wrote: I just checked back here.  I now I have a bump on my right arm pit.  Under the skin.  I'm going to call my doctor monday.  I don't understand what's going on with me.  I've been real tired lately as well.
Posts.Title: Please I need some advice about what to do. Kimmi98660 rcm
